alert.note: Alert for Huntingdon; Juniata; Mifflin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL HUNTINGDON... SOUTHERN MIFFLIN...SOUTHWESTERN JUNIATA...SOUTHWESTERN PERRY AND WESTERN CUMBERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 439 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southeast of Huntingdon, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Plainfield, Newville, East Waterford, Bloserville, Walnut Bottom, Perulack, Big Spring State Park, Colonel Denning State Park, Blacklog, Kistler, Blain, Newton Hamilton and New Germantown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and south central Pennsylvania.
